An editorial theme for tumblr

In 2010 I was looking for a sober, type-led tumblr theme to start jotting down design concerns that occupied my thoughts. I’m not a good writer and my ideas are few and far between, but as @RellyAB once said, To become a good writer, you need to do a lot of shitty writing first.1

By using the tumblr platform, the predicted paucity of written updates could at least be mitigated with other types of media to keep it from becoming another graveyard. It also had the added benefit of being separate from my portfolio in case it was complete garbage.

There were (and are) a wealth of themes to choose from, but I couldn’t find precisely what I was looking for. Either the type choices weren’t right, or it had artefacts or detailing I found extraneous, or it was just too gimmicky. (On reflection, this whole foray might have just have been a subconscious avoidance strategy to keep me from doing what I feared. It was still a good exercise.)

Georgia ++
